description.narrative: Viamericas Corporation (Viamericas) is in the business of cross border money transfer. Transfers originate at over 2,500 retail locations in 40 US states, on the phone or online. The termination of the payment takes place at over 32,000 payout locations in 18 Latin America countries. Viamericas has regional operating centers in Mexico and Colombia. The purpose of IFCs proposed funding is to help expand the Company''s operations in Mexico and Colombia, increase network coverage in the Latin America region and finance Companys growing working capital requirements by pre-funding agents in Latin America.

i. Viamericas enables low cost, expedient, money transfer services to millions of low income families in Latin America. In the ten largest US to LAC remittance corridor countries, the cost of a remittance transfer through Viamericas is up to 40% below the cost of other major providers. A significant number of beneficiaries are in rural areas where remittances serve as the main, if not only, source of income. ii. Viamericas leverages its payout network to extend the reach of financial services to unbanked populations in LAC for opening and funding of bank accounts, buying pre-paid payment cards, etc. iii. Viamericas employs more than 70% of its employees in Colombia and Mexico, in areas such as accounting & finance, legal & compliance and technology services and company plans to more than double its staff in these countries over next three years. IFC''s investment will create additional employment opportunities for highly skilled staff in these markets.
